abstract: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, testified under oath that the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben Bernanke, and then-Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson pressured him to not discuss its plan to buy Merrill Lynch, The Wall Street Journal reported.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth D. Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, testified under oath that the Federal Reserve chairman, Ben Bernanke, and then-Treasury Secretary Henry M. Paulson pressured him to not discuss its plan to buy Merrill Lynch, The Wall Street Journal reported.

headline.main: Lewis Said to Testify That U.S. Urged Silence on Merrill Deal

abstract: Fiat, the Italian automaker, is considering an acquisition of General Motors‘ Opel division in Europe, and has discussed a potential deal with government negotiators in Washington, executives at G.M. and representatives of the German government, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz reported, citing several officials involved in the talks.
lead_paragraph: Fiat, the Italian automaker, is considering an acquisition of General Motors‘ Opel division in Europe, and has discussed a potential deal with government negotiators in Washington, executives at G.M. and representatives of the German government, The New York Times’s Nelson D. Schwartz reported, citing several officials involved in the talks.

headline.main: Fiat Said to Consider Buying G.M.’s Opel Unit
